body: @lostanlen Do your benchmarks take care of this automatically?
@janden what do we decide about this one?(keep it this way?) what should we do about the ASV branch?

So it should just be a matter of running ASV on a few standard machines and updating the timings in the docs manually. That branch (you're talking about [this one](https://github.com/eickenberg/kymatio/tree/add_asv_to_circle_ci), right?) will eventually automate pushing the latest ASV results to a separate website, but we're pretty far off right now.
ok so this will be the last issue to close.
Sorry, but this needs to be in 0.2 since the tests have changed somewhat.

does anybody know how to do this?
I can go and try to figure it out, but it might take me some hours

I can run ASV on some of the FI nodes (V100, P100 or K40) and report the results. Thing is, we need the other baselines: ScatNet (I can do this one too), MATLAB [OM15] (what is this, ScatNet*Light*?), and PyScatWave (is this still runnable?). We might also want ASV results on some consumer card, like 1080Ti.

yeah so how do we distribute this easiest?
Is asv set up that we can just run a command on different machines?

Log into the machine, then (assuming you've `pip install`ed `asv`)
```
cd benchmarks
asv run
```
and keep pressing enter. The results are then stored with the hostname in the folder `results`.
Like I said, I can run it on the cluster tomorrow and do the MATLAB timing as well. It's more the other stuff that I need help with.

> the other stuff 

I can do 1080ti

Maybe @edouardoyallon can do PyScatWave and/or ScatNetLight?
asv actually doesn't run for me. It's can't create the environment it wants to create. Because it can't find pytorch. Do you not get this error? It might be a conda thing
I got it on my laptop too. Not sure what's going on. Could be that torch has to be installed through the torch channel (not the standard conda one).
Yep, so `conda-channels` was commented. I uncommented, which gives access to conda-forge, and it still fails. Let me see if I can add the pytorch channel there
Change the environment engine from `conda` to `virtualenv` and now it looks like it's running
Huh. Weird. Can you make a PR?
